result.execSummary:
The defendant Kennen M Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1519  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

records.addlTxt:
Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:38
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Patrick G. Schilling.  Corey Charles Stephan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CASH BAIL SHALL REVERT TO A SIGNATURE BOND ON 8/11/2014 AT 8:00 AM.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Cash bail is set at $500.00 per case. This cash bail shall revert to a signature bond on 8/11/2014 at 8:00 AM in the amount of $500.00 per case. Defendant must immediately report to DCBM.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public. The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 1

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
